intro: Aconogonon hultenianum, commonly known as the Hultén's aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is known for its tall, erect stems. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in late summer. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
